item.title: 冬季风暴导致肯塔基州断电并引发洪水
item.description: 一场巨大的冬季风暴给肯塔基州和田纳西州带来了毁灭性的洪灾，全美数百架航班停飞，南方 50 多万用户断电。【原文：A huge winter storm brought devastating flooding to Kentucky and Tennessee, grounded hundreds of flights across the US and knocked out power to more than half a million customers in the South.】

item.title: 特朗普终止应对灾害机构内部的气候工作
item.description:
一份发给美国国土安全部领导层的备忘录命令取消与气候有关的活动。【原文：

A memo sent to leadership at the US Department of Homeland Security orders the elimination of climate-related activities.

】

item.title: 天气预报员称本周英国将重现阳光
item.description: 英国气象局表示，在英国大部分地区经历了上周的持续阴霾之后，阳光即将回归。【原文：Sunshine is set to return after much of the UK experienced persistent gloom over the last week, the Met Office said.】

item.title: 从纽约市到多伦多，混乱的冬季风暴将带来降雪和降雨
item.description: 纽约和美国东北部地区将在周六夜间迎来一场冬季暴风雪，这场暴风雪还将覆盖中西部和安大略省南部地区，降雪量将达到几英寸。【原文：New York and the US Northeast will pick up a few inches of snow overnight on Saturday from a winter storm that will also blanket the Midwest and southern Ontario.】

item.title: 特朗普就禁止汽油车问题向加州施压
item.description: 特朗普政府正在对加州汽车污染法规进行初步打击，迫使零排放汽车销售，总统称这些法规扼杀了消费者的选择权。【原文：The Trump administration is delivering an initial strike against California car pollution regulations compelling zero-emission vehicle sales that the president says are strangling consumer choice.】

item.title: 飓风减弱后澳大利亚铁矿石出口枢纽将重新开放
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的铁矿石港口预计将在周六晚些时候重新开放，因为它没有受到强烈热带气旋 "泽利亚 "的严重破坏。【原文：Australia’s biggest iron ore port is expected to reopen later Saturday after being spared any major damage from Severe Tropical Cyclone Zelia.】

item.title: 美国政府大清洗：环保局解雇近 400 名员工
item.description: 环境保护局周五表示，它已解雇了 388 名员工，这是本周在埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 "政府效率部"（Department of Government Efficiency）推动下联邦政府解雇员工浪潮的一部分。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency said Friday it had fired 388 workers, part of a wave of terminations across the federal government this week spurred by Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.】

item.title: 达菲称得克萨斯州石油出口港将获得特朗普团队的支持
item.description: 美国交通部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）表示，特朗普政府计划 "推进 "对 Sentinel Midstream LLC 提议在得克萨斯州建设的一个每天可装运 100 万桶石油的港口的审批。【原文：Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said the Trump administration planned to “move forward” with approval of a Texas port capable of shipping 1 million barrels of oil a day proposed by Sentinel Midstream LLC.】

item.title: 特朗普将成立白宫委员会推动能源主导地位
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五将签署一项命令，成立 "国家能源主导委员会"，负责指导美国在这一问题上的政策，强调他致力于推动已经创下纪录的国内石油和天然气生产。【原文：President Donald Trump on Friday is slated to sign an order creating a “national energy dominance council,” and will task it with steering US policy on the issue, underscoring his commitment to driving already record-setting domestic oil and gas production.】

item.title: 特朗普解除拜登的禁令后将批准天然气出口项目
item.description: 据一位高级政府官员透露，特朗普政府准备首次批准液化天然气出口项目，以兑现其释放燃料运输洪流的承诺。【原文：The Trump administration is poised to grant its first approval for a project to export liquefied natural gas as the administration seeks to make good on a pledge to unleash a torrent of fuel shipments, according to a senior administration official.】

item.title: 石油巨头准备重启战略，英国石油公司投资者欢迎埃利奥特
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）的几位股东表示，他们欢迎激进分子埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）入股这家英国石油巨头，因为该公司需要进行有意义的变革。【原文：Several BP Plc shareholders said they welcome activist Elliott Investment Management taking a stake in the British oil major because the company needs to make meaningful changes.】

item.title: 下周从芝加哥到纽约的寒流将袭击美国
item.description: 下周，随着北极寒流从加拿大南下，一股横跨美国中西部的冷空气将袭击美国东部地区，给电网带来考验，并使取暖燃料需求急剧上升。【原文：A burst of frigid air across the Midwest will pummel the US East next week, testing power grids and sending heating-fuel demand sharply higher as arctic cold pushes south from Canada.】

item.title: 可持续 "投资者逃离气候变化话题
item.description:
共和党对 ESG 的成功攻击以及唐纳德-特朗普的再次当选让所有人都在四处躲藏。【原文：

The success of Republican attacks on ESG and Donald Trump’s re-election has everyone running for cover.

】

item.title: 国际能源机构称，全球用电量将大幅增加
item.description: 随着世界各地的人们使用更多电力来运行空调、工业和不断增长的数据中心，未来几年的电力需求将急剧增长。【原文：Electricity demand is set to increase sharply in the coming years as people around the world use more power to run air conditioners, industry and a growing fleet of data centers.】

item.title: 强气旋将于周五袭击澳大利亚铁矿中心
item.description: 澳大利亚的铁矿石出口枢纽正在为周五晚些时候登陆的大型热带气旋做好准备，皮尔巴拉地区的港口设施、矿山和基础设施将受到冲击。【原文：Australia’s iron ore export hub is bracing for a major tropical cyclone to make landfall later Friday, with port facilities, mines and infrastructure in the Pilbara region in the firing line.】

item.title: 首席执行官表示，PG&E 公司需要加州的帮助来平息火灾后的投资者情绪
item.description: PG&E 公司希望加利福尼亚州及时为该州 210 亿美元的公用事业保险基金提供支持，因为在最近洛杉矶地区发生的毁灭性大火之后，该基金面临被耗尽的风险。【原文：PG&E Corp. wants California to promptly shore up the state’s $21 billion insurance fund for utilities that is at risk of being drained following the recent devastating fires in the Los Angeles area.】

item.title: 欧盟计划简化国家援助规则以促进清洁投资
item.description: 欧盟正计划制定更简单、更有针对性的国家补助规则，以鼓励清洁技术投资，提高该地区在与美国和中国竞争时的工业竞争力。【原文：The European Union is planning simpler, targeted state-aid rules to encourage clean tech investments and boost the region’s industrial competitiveness against the US and China.】

item.title: 杜克能源在建造更多天然气厂时删除气候语言
item.description: 美国最大的电力供应商之一杜克能源公司（Duke Energy Corp）在其最新发布的财报中删除了气候目标的提法，因为该公司正在建造更多的天然气发电厂，并重新考虑其煤炭计划。【原文：Duke Energy Corp., one of the biggest US power providers, removed a mention of climate targets in its latest earnings release as the company builds more natural gas plants and reconsiders its coal plans.】

item.title: 公用事业 "全速 "发展数据中心
item.description: 美国最大的两家公用事业公司表示，即使在中国人工智能公司 DeepSeek 对未来电力需求增长提出质疑之后，它们的数据中心客户仍在 "全速前进"。【原文：Two of the US biggest utilities said that their data center customers are proceeding “full speed ahead” even after Chinese artificial intelligence company DeepSeek threw questions over the future for power-demand growth.】

item.title: 洛杉矶面临暴雨泥石流风险
item.description: 由于上个月毁灭性野火烧毁的土地周四普降大雨，引发了疏散命令，洛杉矶正准备应对可能发生的泥石流。【原文：Los Angeles is bracing for possible mudslides as heavy rain falls Thursday across land burned by last month’s devastating wildfires, triggering evacuation orders.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结招聘令野火救援人员陷入混乱
item.description:
联邦消防部队正面临着不确定性，火灾季节即将来临，而洛杉矶大火几乎还未从后视镜中消失。【原文：

The federal firefighting force is facing uncertainty with fire season just around the corner and the Los Angeles fires barely in the rearview mirror.

】

item.title: 特朗普与美国国家海洋和大气管理局的斗争远不止天气这么简单
item.description: 美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）已成为唐纳德-特朗普总统裁减联邦工作人员和对行政部门机构施加新限制计划的目标。【原文：The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, or NOAA, has emerged as a target of President Donald Trump’s program of downsizing the federal workforce and imposing new restrictions on executive branch agencies.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州 10 亿美元的保险公司救助加深了住房压力
item.description: 加州的住房市场已经是全国最昂贵的市场之一。旧金山一套公寓的价格相当于德克萨斯州一栋四居室的房子，一些家庭驱车数小时前往内陆地区，只为寻找一套起步房。【原文：California’s housing market is already one of the most expensive in the country. A San Francisco condo can cost as much as a four-bedroom house in Texas and families drive hours inland just to find a starter home.】

item.title: 匈牙利电池产量下滑，欧尔班的电动汽车希望破灭
item.description: 匈牙利电池行业的产量在去年年底急剧下降，削弱了总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）关于电动汽车需求将有助于扭转经济的赌注。【原文：Hungary’s battery-sector output plummeted at the end of last year, undermining Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s bet that demand for electric vehicles will help turn round the economy.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行与欧洲投资银行设立 10 亿欧元风能担保基金
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）和欧洲投资银行（European Investment Bank）正在合作建立一个 10 亿欧元（10 亿美元）的银行担保组合，旨在支持对欧盟风力发电场的投资。【原文：BNP Paribas SA and the European Investment Bank are partnering to create a €1 billion ($1 billion) portfolio of bank guarantees designed to back investments in EU wind farms.】

item.title: Galvanize 聘用前美国能源部投资主管负责特殊情况投资
item.description: 亿万富翁汤姆-斯泰尔（Tom Steyer）的 Galvanize Climate Solutions 雇用了曾在美国能源部贷款办公室负责投资的克里斯-克里德（Chris Creed），专注于特殊情况和结构性融资解决方案。【原文：Billionaire Tom Steyer’s Galvanize Climate Solutions hired Chris Creed, who oversaw investments at the US Department of Energy’s loan office, to focus on special situations and structured-financing solutions.】

item.title: 摩根大通推出由前美国国家大气局科学主管撰写的气候说明
item.description:
"人们需要了解如何从战略角度思考气候问题，"现任该行首席气候顾问的萨拉-卡普尼克说。【原文：

“There is a demand for understanding how to strategically think about climate issues,” said Sarah Kapnick, now the bank’s top climate adviser.

】

item.title: 距离特朗普 8,745 英里的气候反击战
item.description: 在距离华盛顿特区数千英里之外，新西兰可能已经让世界看到了特朗普时代全球气候政策的模样。这个曾经在减排方面处于领先地位的国家，正在进行一系列绿色政策的逆转。请阅读下文。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上找到完整报道。更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Thousands of miles away from Washington, D.C., New Zealand may already be giving the world a glimpse of what global climate policy will look like in the Trump era. The nation, a one-time leader on emissions reductions, has been carrying out a series of green policy reversals. Read more below. You can also find the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 英国向海上风电场支付创纪录的 19 亿英镑补贴
item.description: 去年，英国家庭为近海风电场支付了创纪录的 19 亿英镑（24 亿美元）补贴，以帮助其在可再生能源规模扩大和电力价格下降的情况下增强底气。【原文：UK households paid a record £1.9 billion ($2.4 billion) in subsidies to offshore wind farms last year to help bolster their bottom lines amid an expansion of the renewable energy fleet and a decline in power prices.】

item.title: 欧洲复兴开发银行称可再生能源是波兰降低电价的最佳选择
item.description: 欧洲复兴开发银行称，波兰若想迅速降低能源支出并取代即将停产的燃煤电厂，就应提高可再生能源发电能力。【原文：Poland should ramp up its renewable capacity if it wants to quickly cut energy bills and replace soon-to-be-defunct coal-fired plants, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.】
